title: When the World's Strongest Man Became a Farmer

tasks.task: Create social media content involving a farmer character
subtasks: Plan and conceptualize farm-related activities featuring a strongman (e.g., Hafthor)
Arrange for Hafthor to participate in farming-themed activities, such as meditation in a field
Film or photograph the staged farming scene with Hafthor
Edit the footage/videos for the intended social media platform
Share the content on appropriate social media channels to attract followers

tasks.task: Engage with an existing online community
subtasks: Monitor social media for user engagement and reactions
Analyze the demographic of new followers attracted to the content

tasks.task: Foster brand loyalty through relatable content
subtasks: Continuously create engaging content that resonates with the target audience (American farmers)

tasks.task: Reflect on the success of the campaign
subtasks: Assess the number of followers gained during the initial release
Reflect on the unexpected appeal of the farmer character concept

tasks.task: ??? IMPLEMENTATION!!! Oh, right. The process was to get Hafthor to pretend he was a farmer and meditate in a field. Then post it as a joke or something. Then people started following. So I would generate content that makes fun of him being clueless, but acting like a farmer. But in the end, people were interested because it was an unexpected image. Maybe there's market for parody or satire around fitness influencers/unrealistic physiques interacting with farm life. That's a niche, but there might be some niche.farmtwitter or something
